text: Like so many of you, I have spent PERCENT of my adult life in business and PERCENT in government. Not with the sparkling success that some in this room have had as business people, but nevertheless, I understand it. I built a business from the ground up. I met a payroll, created jobs, and worked for a living. I happen to think that that is a good qualification for being ENTITY of GPE, because I believe it is a prospering small business or large business environment that is going to do more to help people. Put it this way, a job in the private sector is going to do more to help people than Government programs can. what makes an economy grow. It is not the people who take your taxes and spend them. It is you who make the economy grow, ordinary men and women with the extraordinary dreams who have the grit to make those dreams real. And I am very grateful to what PERSON does in taking this message of small business out around this country. That understanding is really at the heart of what PERSON again referred to as the Agenda for American Renewal. I talk about the global economy and then what we are going to do now to be the lead. We have the strongest economy; I want to help make it stronger. To do this, we have got to unleash the energy, the brainpower of our workers and our entrepreneurs, and again, particularly in small business because this is the area that employs the most and takes the risks and creates the new opportunities. I want to encourage investment so that wages rise and those unemployment lines shrink. That is why I am helping small business in particular and, hopefully, all business in general. We unveiled a good small business program DATE down in GPE. Reducing the corporate tax rate for small business PERCENT; increasing the amount of equipment that small business can expense, and thus that would create more jobs and new opportunities; simplifying the tax filing. Most small-business people know that the onerous reporting for tax purposes takes too many TIME, too many people TIME, and we are trying to change that Then, of course, I still feel that to stimulate risk-taking, the reduction in the capital gains is very, very important, bringing people into the enterprise zones in the minority areas; a reduction in capital gains, a break on that will help attract jobs to the areas that need it the very most.

text: They have been very cooperative in almost every case, if not every case in the past, and of course, the closer we get to a convention or an election, their problem gets more and more difficult. I think there is an old saying, honesty is the best policy, because you inevitably get caught if you do not tell the truth and your conscience is clear if you do tell the truth. I can disagree with what some of our children do, but as long as they are honest with us and at least give us an opportunity to express our views, I do not think I should go any further. text: Through painful experience, it became clear that the old approach of promoting stability is unsuited to this new danger, and that the pursuit of security at the expense of liberty would leave us with neither one. Across the Middle East, many who sought a voice in the future of their countries found the only places open to dissent were radical FAC. Many turned to terror as a source of empowerment. And as DATE dawned, the violent currents swirling beneath the Middle East began to surface. In the Holy Land, the dashed expectations resulting from the collapse of the FAC peace talks had given way to the second intifada. NORP suicide bombers struck with horrific frequency and lethality. They murdered innocent NORP at a pizza parlor or aboard buses or in the middle of a Passover Seder. ORG responded with large-scale operations. And in DATE, CARDINAL NORP and NORP were killed. Politically, ORG was led by a terrorist who stole from his people and walked away from peace. In GPE, PERSON was elected to fight terror and pursue a greater GPE policy that allowed for no territorial concessions. Neither side could envision a return to negotiations or the realistic possibility of a CARDINAL-state solution. Elsewhere in the Middle East, PERSON had begun DATE as the dictator of GPE, a reign that included invading CARDINAL neighbors, developing and using weapons of mass destruction, attempting to exterminate NORP and many NORP, paying the families of suicide bombers, systematically violating ORG resolutions, and firing routinely at NORP and GPE aircraft patrolling a no-fly zone. GPE continued its occupation of GPE, with CARDINAL troops on NORP soil. GPE sponsored terror and pursued weapons of mass destruction. And in GPE, the prospect for of reform was fading, the regime's sponsorship of terror continued, and its pursuit of nuclear weapons was largely unchecked. Throughout the region, suffering and stagnation were rampant. ORG revealed a bleak picture of high unemployment, poor education, high mortality rates for mothers, and almost no investment in technology. Above all, the Middle East suffered a deep deficit in freedom. Most people had no choice and no voice in choosing their leaders. Women enjoyed few rights, and there was little conversation about democratic change. Against this backdrop, the terrorist movement was growing in strength and in ambition.
